numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Clean electricity sources include nuclear energy and wind energy and solar energy and hydroelectric energy.
2. Worldwide, the output of electricity from clean electricity sources has increased over time.
3. Worldwide, the output of electricity from fossil fuels has increased over time.
4. The increase in the output of electricity from clean electricity sources is greater than the increase in the output of electricity from fossil fuels.
5. The graphs show electricity generation for individual countries.
6. In the United States, the output of electricity from clean electricity sources has increased only slightly over time.
7. In the United States, coal usage has decreased in electricity generation over time.
8. In the United States, coal is the only source that has decreased in electricity generation over time.
9. I am curious why the United States is less reliant on coal.
10. The cost of mining coal may be a reason.
11. The United States may prioritize investment in clean electricity sources.
12. If the United States spends more on clean electricity sources, then policymakers are becoming more conscious of the need to protect the environment.
13. If policymakers protect the environment, then the planet can be habitable for the next generation.
14. The title of this graph is: Electricity Generation for our Next Generation.
